programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather.(n)

programme.title: Rip Off Britain
programme.desc: Angela Rippon, Gloria Hunniford and Julia Somerville investigate a government agency that claims it owns drives and gardens of private properties - and has the right to sell them.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts and Dion Dublin examine the potential of a pair of flats in Clay Cross, Chesterfield, a two-bed apartment in South Norwood, London and a plot of land in Stafford.(n)

programme.title: Caught Red Handed
programme.desc: A couple restoring a house, who had earlier disagreed about installing CCTV, but later found the cameras proved their worth after an intruder invaded their dream home. Plus, the man robbing a pizza takeaway who got a taste of his own medicine when another thief took his bike. Presented by Dom Littlewood.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Charlie Ross is joined by experts Thomas Plant and Nick Hall at Nottingham racecourse, and finds out how black and immigrant miners helped fuel Nottinghamshire.(n)

programme.title: The Heights
programme.desc: An uncomfortable encounter awaits Leonie, while Mark's resolve is tested.(n)

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts the game show in which contestants compete for the chance to win £10,000, with a single 'impossible' answer knocking them out for the day.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin visits Shropshire in search of a country home for a pair of free spirits who have a £300,000 budget with which to finally lay down some roots. Jonnie also gets in the saddle on a ride through the Shropshire hills with a bespoke bike builder.(n)

programme.title: Home Is Where the Art Is
programme.desc: Nick Knowles challenges an abstract artist, an intuitive painter, and a stained glass worker to create a bespoke piece for buyers in Cheddar who want something uplifting.(n)

programme.title: The Repair Shop: Fixing Britain
programme.desc: Jay Blades narrates an insight into the maritime history of three items restored on programme - a precious box, a book of cuttings about Captain Scott, and a handmade teddy bear.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: DEC Coronavirus Appeal
programme.desc: An appeal on behalf of the Disasters Emergency Committee to help those affected by Coronavirus.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Scott and Gethin Jones present another mix of nationwide reports and live studio-based chat.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: A classic episode from 2019 featuring Walford's first ever Gay Pride. Callum gets more than he bargained for when Tina ropes him in to help with the Pride celebrations - but he is mortified when Stuart turns up and tells him he saw him kissing Ben the night before. Karen rounds up the family to celebrate Bernadette's first Pride, although Bernadette herself does not seem in the mood. Meanwhile, Kat calls a meeting about the stolen money and Iqra delivers Adam an ultimatum.(n)

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Nicky wakes up in hospital to find her overbearing mother interfering in both her work and personal life. She takes the opportunity to reassess her priorities. Fletch and Essie befriend a cancer patient, but the relationship forces all three of them to confront some ugly truths about what the future holds. Guy tries to prove he still has what it takes, and tries to persuade Max to approve a risky operation.(n)

programme.title: The Secrets She Keeps
programme.desc: A media campaign is launched to find the baby, with Jack giving a press conference outside the hospital. The renewed interest in the case puts pressure on Agatha to conceal the truth as Hayden's return brings her closer to having her perfect family.(n)

programme.title: Staged
programme.desc: David and Michael struggle to regain each other's trust, and a show producer has to step in to try and repair the damage. Meanwhile, Michael gets drawn deeper into the situation with his neighbour, and David is worried about Georgia's plans to help a friend who is in labour. Comedy, starring Michael Sheen and David Tennant.(n)

programme.title: DEC Coronavirus Appeal
programme.desc: An appeal on behalf of the Disasters Emergency Committee to help those affected by Coronavirus.(n)

programme.title: I May Destroy You
programme.desc: Arabella encounters her attacker David, and asks Terry and Theo to help her get revenge. Approaching him in a nightclub, they plan to dose him with the same sedative he used on her. However, when he gets away from them, they are forced to use increasingly violent methods to subdue him. As the long night draws to a close, Arabella finds her memories of the night coming into sharper focus, and is forced to quickly come to terms with both her own secrets and those of David. Conclusion of the drama written by and starring Michaela Coel.(n)

programme.title: How's Your Head, Hun
programme.sub-title: How's Your Head, Hun? With Michelle Visage
programme.desc: Michelle's daughter Lola gets a homemade prom in the back garden, complete with balloons, corsages, slow dancing and a surprise guest. The Drag Race judge also chats to Community's Joel McHale about how he has been coping with lockdown, and challenges comedian Alan Carr to a game of Would You Rather?(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Home Is Where the Art Is
programme.desc: A molten glass specialist, an Icelandic abstract artist and a self-taught metal sculptor create artworks for tottery winners who want to celebrate the day their lives changed.(n)

programme.title: The Repair Shop: Fixing Britain
programme.desc: Jay Blades investigates the UK's espionage history through three items restored on the programme, including a bike and teapot linked to undercover operatives.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Rachel de Thame reviews the progress of her new kitchen garden, and begins planting out peas and sowing flower seeds. Nick Bailey shows how to make an easy cold frame for storing precious plants and seedlings, and Joe Swift meets Will Young, whose new-found love of gardening was key to his recovery from mental health problems.(n)

programme.title: Into the Wild with Gordon Buchanan
programme.desc: The naturalist takes broadcaster John Simpson to the Cairngorms in search of the rarest and most elusive creature in the UK - the Scottish wildcat. On their journey the pair make their way up the mountains on the lookout for reindeer and one of the hardiest little birds, the ptarmigan. Red squirrels inhabit the pine forests as does another creature that John would love to see - the pine marten. The BBC's world affairs editor proves a fascinating companion with many tales to tell, while the duo wait for the wildlife to appear.(n)

programme.title: The Boss
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Susan Calman in which one contestant becomes the Boss and has to use judgement and tactics to decide which player is best suited to answer questions.(n)

programme.title: Best Bakes Ever
programme.desc: Actress and cake expert Jane Asher presents another selection of recipes from TV chefs, including the likes of James Martin, Mary Berry, Paul Hollywood, the Hairy Bikers, Raymond Blanc, Nigella Lawson, Tom Kerridge, Lorraine Pascale and Rachel Khoo.(n)

programme.title: Wild China
programme.desc: The country's diverse wildlife, beginning by exploring how rural Chinese peasants in the south have developed a relationship with the region's animal inhabitants - including how water buffalo are used in agriculture, and tamed cormorants help their owners to fish.(n)

programme.title: Olympics Rewind
programme.desc: Sue Barker narrates the first part of a look back at the Games, featuring the opening six days, including gold medals for Great Britain's Rebecca Adlington and Nicole Cook in swimming and cycling respectively.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: People are invited to try to make money out of their antiques by taking a risk at auction.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Great Australian Railway Journeys
programme.sub-title: Port Augusta to Darwin - Part Two
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels on the second leg of the Ghan Railway from Alice Springs to Darwin. Along the way, he meets orphaned joeys at a kangaroo sanctuary, discovers the story of an early 20th-century cattle tycoon and meets the family that run one of his former ranches, explores traditional aboriginal lands, and joins Darwin locals in commemorating the 100th anniversary of a First World War battle.(n)

programme.title: DEC Coronavirus Appeal
programme.desc: An appeal on behalf of the Disasters Emergency Committee to help those affected by Coronavirus.(n)

programme.title: Back in Time for..
programme.desc: The decade after the Second World War sees the Ellis family on rations without a fridge, hot water or an electric cooker. Thrifty fodder includes the regional favourites cow heel pie and Yorkshire pudding made with dried eggs, and while the cost of food is low, family spirits are high. The insecurity of the hungry thirties has been replaced by the promise of a fairer society for working class families with government commitment to full employment and better housing and healthcare. Plus, two new family members - chickens Sara and Polly - treat them to fresh eggs. Sara Cox and Polly Russell present.(n)

programme.title: Amazing Hotels: Life Beyond the Lobby
programme.desc: Giles Coren and Monica Galetti visit a hi-tech hotel in the self-governing Chinese gambling capital of Macau. Monica gets special access to a secret set of VIP suites dubbed The Mansion, where it takes more than just money to book an exclusive room. Giles visits a special theatre that sends its audience flying through the air, and helps to arrange the flowers for the Chinese New Year celebrations.(n)

programme.title: The Rise of the Murdoch Dynasty
programme.desc: Three-part documentary about the media mogul's influence on international politics and the power struggles within his own family. The first episode focuses on the build-up to the 1997 general election, where Rupert Murdoch had to decide if his business interests were best served by the continuation of John Major's struggling government, or a new Labour leadership under Tony Blair. Eventually, the full force of his media empire is placed behind the rising Labour leader, but some question how high a price was paid. Elsewhere, Murdoch marries a woman 37 years younger than he is, dividing his children and jeopardising his plans to choose a successor.(n)

programme.title: Live Aid

programme.title: Into the Wild with Gordon Buchanan
programme.desc: The naturalist takes broadcaster John Simpson to the Cairngorms in search of the rarest and most elusive creature in the UK - the Scottish wildcat. On their journey the pair make their way up the mountains on the lookout for reindeer and one of the hardiest little birds, the ptarmigan. Red squirrels inhabit the pine forests as does another creature that John would love to see - the pine marten. The BBC's world affairs editor proves a fascinating companion with many tales to tell, while the duo wait for the wildlife to appear.(n)

programme.title: Back in Time for..
programme.desc: The decade after the Second World War sees the Ellis family on rations without a fridge, hot water or an electric cooker. Thrifty fodder includes the regional favourites cow heel pie and Yorkshire pudding made with dried eggs, and while the cost of food is low, family spirits are high. The insecurity of the hungry thirties has been replaced by the promise of a fairer society for working class families with government commitment to full employment and better housing and healthcare. Plus, two new family members - chickens Sara and Polly - treat them to fresh eggs. Sara Cox and Polly Russell present.(n)

programme.title: Amazing Hotels: Life Beyond the Lobby

programme.title: River Walks
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher walks an eight-mile route along the River Lea, taking in the landmarks of an industrial past and discovering what the future holds for the waterway in this fast-growing part of the capital.(n)

programme.title: The Joy of Painting
programme.desc: Bob Ross paints a rugged mountain scene, with a brook flowing through it.(n)

programme.title: Rise of the Nazis
programme.sub-title: The First Six Months in Power
programme.desc: It is 1933 and Adolf Hitler is the chancellor of Germany, but he does not have absolute power as there is still a democratic parliament, a head of state and the rule of law. Hitler calls a general election to increase Nazi representation, but a fire in the Reichstag building is blamed on communists - prompting thousands of arrests of left-wingers. Hitler then calls on President von Hindenburg to act and a decree is passed giving the Nazis emergency powers to ban free speech and the right to protest.(n)

programme.title: Ancient Invisible Cities
programme.desc: In Turkey, Michael Scott uses 3D-scanning technology to examine the once enormous Hippodrome, which began as a stadium for chariot racing, though its foundations were later converted into a huge water cistern to supply the Emperor's Great Palace. Michael unearths a holy well, hidden 30 feet under a carpet shop and, conversely, walks high above the city on the most sophisticated and longest aqueduct of the Roman world, finding that part of the Great Palace of Constantine is now a burnt-out shell. Along the way Michael finds time for a shave in the Sultan's Grande Bazaar and uncovers the engineering innovations of the Suleymaniye Mosque.(n)

programme.title: Storyville
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the campaign to save the US's last standing roller rinks from closure against a backdrop of growing racial tension. The film reveals the story of underground subculture that has grown up around these venues and given rise to some of the world's greatest musical talent - but has itself remained virtually unknown to the mainstream.(n)

programme.title: Being Beethoven
programme.desc: A look at how the composer's return to the town of Heiligenstadt led to one of the most extraordinary outpourings of creativity in the history of music, from the earth-shattering Eroica through to Symphony No. 7, while his repeated failed attempts to find love resulted in the famous Immortal Beloved letter found after his death.(n)
